This way of looking at is is completely inaccurate for several reasons:
a) not being nerfed in forever is a buff in and of its self
b) power shifts in other champions effect the viability of a champion, especially counters to said champ, for example if the majority of people that counter pantheon get a nerf, pantheon gets buffed vicariously.
c) by altering the jungle to be more aggressive, it opens up a huge advantage to sustainers because they can get ahead in cs as well as counter jungle you with little resistance.
d) when an item becomes so well matched for a champion, especially one that does true damage this is a buff to the champ for all intents and purposes. Look at Fiora and Hydra which they had to recently nerf. In the case of Warwick the fact that both smite and his ult have the same range and are click targets and does true damage leaves no counterplay.

His win rate has gone up from 55 to 60 percent which, to be above 50 is pretty devastating, but 60 is ridiculous.
I love it, that its not ok for WW to have a 59% winrate but it's ok for jinx to have almost the exact winrate as of late and yet not 1 person has mention nerf Jinx.  Just some food for thought.

I greatly disagree. Warwick has always been a feast or famine champ, he either does well and snowballs to the point he he cant be killed or is useless once his ult is over. What devourer has done is give him exactly what he needs to snowball in a relatively inexpensive item that builds out of his starter item. His pre 6 power remains the same since he has always been capable of sustaining himself in the jungle but his post 6 with an early devourer is to much to fast. 

the instant he gets devourer he can start targeting the glass canons and take them out with ease furthering his snowball. There is a reason his ult cooldown went up at the same time the preseason started. issue is they recreated the feral flare fiasco by giving devourer way to much to early. the item still should have to get stacked before dealing as much damage as it does when it is first purchased right now.

If you were to go play a game as Warwick and not build devourer he would feel no different if not weaker than before preseason. that itself tells you that it is the item and not the champ that is creating the fringe power problem.

The exact same thing happened back when feral flare was first released on live. Warwick and xin zhao became the front runners in the jungle back then just like they are now, only difference being that Warwick is even stronger than xin thanks to the addition of the skirmisher smite alteration.

Im right there with you that Warwick is way to strong right now. I just know that its the Item and not the champ that is the problem.

It might seem like a champ isn't viable when it is really that they dont fit in with the current trends. When their niche cycles back into favor they will likely pop right back into a viable pick. Obviously this is not always the case and especially if nerfs are done to champs when it is an item causing the issue. I have faith that Riot is more than aware about the issue devourer has caused and are implementing changes. If that is not what happens and nerfs roll out to champs I will be right there on the fore front of the argument to revert any such changes.

The item is the problem, a simple change can be made to fix it but it is up to Riot to follow through obviously.
